summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Vladimir Slovoda. The documents primarily concern investigations into potential US Army defectors, background checks on military personnel, and correspondence related to these investigations. Key figures mentioned include Peter K. Simons, Roman D. S. Arnold, Kenneth C. Griggs, Joseph Timothy White, and John Joseph Dowling. The documents detail their personal histories, military service, and potential reasons for defection or desertion. There are also mentions of individuals involved in these investigations, such as Philip LaChapelle Jr. and Cecil L. Griggs. The documents span from 1966 to 1982 and consist of agent reports, messages, and exhibit cover sheets.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Vladimir Slovoda has no significance in the JFK context as they are not mentioned in any of the documents.
